citeinfo.title: China historical 1990 county population census data - Part A

pubinfo.publish: All China Marketing Research Co. ; distributed by University of Michigan China Data Center, Ann Arbor, Mich.

citeinfo.origin: Beijing Hua tong ren shi chang xin xi you xian ze ren gong si
University of Michigan. China Data Center
citeinfo.title: Historical county population census data with maps : 1953, 1964, 1982, 1990, 2000
citeinfo.othercit: CD-ROM / distributed by University of Michigan China Data Center, Ann Arbor, Mich.

descript.abstract:
This polygon datalayer includes China county boundaries with 1990 population census data. It is one (Part A) of two layers containing the entire 1990 population census data.
The 1990 administrative maps were primarily based on the "The Administrative Maps of the People's Republic of China," published by China Map Press, and some other yearly administrative maps.
This datalayer is part of the Historical county population census data with maps: 1953, 1964, 1982, 1990, 2000 data set produced by the All China Marketing Research Co. and distributed by the University of Michigan, China Data Center (2005).
The historical county population Census data include population Census data for China at county level for 1953, 1964, 1980, 1990, and 2000, which are integrated with associated county GIS maps.
descript.purpose: The data set was developed for display and analysis using GIS.

idinfo.accconst: Available only to Harvard University affiliates. Affiliates are limited to current faculty, staff and students.
idinfo.useconst: No part of this data product is allowed to be reproduced or re-distributed to any other parties without permission.

attracc.attraccr: There are no population attribute values for Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau, South China Sea islands, and for some counties of China. This is consistent with the original data source.

CD-ROM layer: china90a.
Distributed by University of Michigan China Data Center, Ann Arbor, Mich.

procstep.procdesc: This layer was downloaded from the CD and opened in ArcMap 9.1. The projection was then defined in ArcMap to Krasovsky_1940, as stated in the "readme.htm" file that was included on the CD. The layer was then imported to an ArcSDE 9.1 geodatabase via the command line importing tool, shp2sde.
